question: [File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/challenge.rs] [Struct: RotationProofChallenge] [Cross-Account Attack] [Challenge Reuse] Can a valid RotationProofChallenge from Account A be reused to rotate Account B's key if they share the same sequence_number and current_auth_key values? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/challenge.rs] [Struct: RotationProofChallenge] [Cross-Account Attack] [Originator Binding] Is the originator field cryptographically bound to the challenge in a way that prevents cross-account attacks, or can it be modified without invalidating signatures? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/challenge.rs] [Struct: RotationProofChallenge] [Cross-Account Attack] [Parallel Rotation] If two accounts attempt rotation simultaneously with identical RotationProofChallenge parameters, can race conditions cause the wrong account to be rotated? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/challenge.rs] [Struct: RotationProofChallenge] [TypeInfo Fields] [Type System Bypass] Can an attacker craft a challenge with (account_address, module_name, struct_name) pointing to a different type in the Move type system, tricking validators into accepting invalid rotation proofs? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/challenge.rs] [Struct: RotationProofChallenge] [TypeInfo Fields] [Module Upgrade Attack] If the account module at CORE_CODE_ADDRESS is upgraded, can old RotationProofChallenge instances with outdated type info still be used, or are they properly invalidated? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/challenge.rs] [Struct: RotationProofChallenge] [TypeInfo Fields] [Package Version Confusion] Can different versions of the aptos-framework package have different RotationProofChallenge layouts, and can this be exploited for replay attacks across network upgrades? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/challenge.rs] [Struct: RotationProofChallenge] [State Consistency] [Stale Challenge] If a RotationProofChallenge is created but not immediately used, and the account state changes (e.g., sequence increments, auth key rotates), is the stale challenge properly rejected? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/challenge.rs] [Struct: RotationProofChallenge] [State Consistency] [Concurrent Rotations] Can multiple valid RotationProofChallenges for the same account be submitted concurrently, and does this cause a race condition where multiple rotations succeed? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/challenge.rs] [Struct: RotationProofChallenge] [State Consistency] [Atomic Validation] Are all fields (sequence_number, originator, current_auth_key) validated atomically against current state, or can TOCTOU issues arise between field validations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/challenge.rs] [Struct: RotationProofChallenge] [Economic Attack] [Gas Griefing] Can an attacker create RotationProofChallenges with minimal gas cost but maximum validation complexity (e.g., oversized new_public_key), causing validator resource exhaustion? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/challenge.rs] [Struct: RotationProofChallenge] [Economic Attack] [Spam Rotations] Can an attacker repeatedly submit valid rotation transactions with incrementing sequence_number, and is there rate limiting to prevent account state spam? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/challenge.rs] [Struct: RotationProofChallenge] [Cryptography] [Chosen Message Attack] Can an attacker influence the contents of RotationProofChallenge (e.g., by controlling originator address or new_public_key) to construct a chosen-message attack against the signature scheme? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/challenge.rs] [Struct: RotationProofChallenge] [Cryptography] [Hash Collision] If RotationProofChallenge is hashed before signing (rather than signing raw BCS bytes), can hash collisions allow different challenges to have the same signature? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/challenge.rs] [Struct: RotationProofChallenge] [Cryptography] [Weak Randomness] Does the creation of RotationProofChallenge rely on any random values, and can predictable randomness allow attackers to pre-compute valid challenges? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/challenge.rs] [Struct: RotationProofChallenge] [Cryptography] [Public Key Recovery] Can the new_public_key be recovered from signatures or other public data, allowing an attacker to reconstruct the private key through side-channel analysis? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/challenge.rs] [Struct: RotationProofChallenge] [Move Integration] [Resource Type Safety] When RotationProofChallenge is used in Move, is it properly marked as a resource type to prevent copying, or can multiple copies of the same challenge exist? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/challenge.rs] [Struct: RotationProofChallenge] [Move Integration] [Ability Restrictions] Does RotationProofChallenge have proper Move abilities (drop, copy, store, key), or can improper abilities allow it to be stored/copied in ways that violate security assumptions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/challenge.rs] [Struct: RotationProofChallenge] [Move Integration] [Global Storage Exploit] Can RotationProofChallenge be stored in global storage and reused later, bypassing sequence_number replay protection? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/challenge.rs] [Struct: RotationProofChallenge] [Move Integration] [Borrowing Violations] In Move, can references to RotationProofChallenge be held across transaction boundaries, allowing stale challenges to be used after state changes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/challenge.rs] [Struct: RotationProofChallenge] [Upgrade] [Struct Evolution] If new fields are added to RotationProofChallenge in future versions, can old challenges still be deserialized, and does this create backward compatibility vulnerabilities? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/challenge.rs] [Struct: RotationProofChallenge] [Upgrade] [Migration Attack] During a protocol upgrade that changes RotationProofChallenge format, can an attacker exploit the transition period to submit old-format challenges to new validators? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/challenge.rs] [Struct: RotationProofChallenge] [Upgrade] [Version Confusion] Can validators running different software versions have different interpretations of RotationProofChallenge fields, causing consensus failures? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/challenge.rs] [Struct: RotationProofChallenge] [DoS] [Deserialization DoS] Can a crafted malicious BCS payload cause exponential deserialization time for RotationProofChallenge, allowing a single transaction to DoS validator nodes? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/challenge.rs] [Struct: RotationProofChallenge] [DoS] [Validation DoS] Can extremely complex RotationProofChallenge validation (e.g., multi-sig with max keys) cause transaction processing delays affecting network liveness? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/challenge.rs] [Struct: RotationProofChallenge] [Edge Case] [Uninitialized Account] Can RotationProofChallenge be used for accounts that don't exist yet, and does this allow pre-rotation attacks where keys are rotated before account creation? (High)
